title: Z3Config.cmake not installed due to Makefile build

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
After running `spack install z3` the installed files did not include the file `Z3Config.cmake`

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install z3
$ find <spack install dir> -type f | grep Z3Config.cmake
<no output>
```

### Error Message
When building a CMake project with a line `find_package(Z3 REQUIRED)` the following occurs:

```console
$ spack install z3
...
$ spack load z3
$ mkdir build
$ cd build
$ cmake ..
...
CMake Error at tools/dlcomp/CMakeLists.txt:1 (find_package):
  By not providing "FindZ3.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has asked
  CMake to find a package configuration file provided by "Z3", but CMake did
  not find one.

  Could not find a package configuration file provided by "Z3" with any of
  the following names:

    Z3Config.cmake
    z3-config.cmake

  Add the installation prefix of "Z3" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set "Z3_DIR" to
  a directory containing one of the above files.  If "Z3" provides a separate
  development package or SDK, be sure it has been installed.
...
```

### Information on your system

```
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3131-ba65cc7
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-sandybridge
* **Concretizer:** original
```

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

The Z3 solver has two build modes: Makefile and CMake. The README.md in the Z3 project states the following regarding CMake: "It is recommended for most build tasks, except for building OCaml bindings."

The CMake implementation was made starting with v4.5.0 of the Z3 solver.

Package changes forthcoming.
